title: Fibromyalgia
summary: Fibromyalgia (FM) is a medical condition characterized by chronic widespread pain and a heightened pain response to pressure.[8] Other symptoms include tiredness to a degree that normal activities are affected, sleep problems,[9][10] and cognitive dysfunctions.[4] Some people also report restless legs syndrome, bowel or bladder problems, numbness and tingling and sensitivity to noise, lights or temperature.[5] Patients with fibromyalgia are more likely to suffer from depression, anxiety and posttraumatic stress disorder.[4]
